title: halim50_
author: halim50_
content: I just wondering, how to be more useful and productive on this forum.I am determined to do a contribution in here but no matter how hard I try I failing to execute my determination.So dear seniors and good peoples, can you please give me some simple but effective Direction to improve me?                                                                                     It will be honor to have some Direction..

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: There isn't any magic wand that will help you to write posts that will get you merit(s). The current section in which you are browsing is Beginners & Help.You will see almost 10-20 new threads being created here daily and if you have any expertise in any of those topics, you can surely contribute your opinion.It's on the OP if they want to take it as useful or not just like this post of mine.Also, there is no need to be productive and useful always as this is a public forum where you have to just share your opinion.Enjoy your time here, learn new things, visit your regional language board and make new friends, and learn and educate yourself about what's going new with Bitcoin and that will be more than enough.No one is an expert here, and I am sure you are calling people with Legendary and Senior Member roles as a senior which is irrelevant as they are the people who just registered before you, nothing else is different.

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: You have taken one step to be more productive by reducing your bounty application posts and trying to be a part of discussions. Next step would be to do more of reading, you can only be as useful to the forum as the forum has been to you.Quote from: halim50_ on April 13, 2023, 06:02:49 AMI am determined to do a contribution in here but no matter how hard I try I failing to execute my determination.You do not need to try too hard to contribute, just be yourself and view this as a discussion platform. Zone out from the merits and ranks and activities and build your knowledge, learn from others and ask questions when you get confused. This is a discussion platform for talking about bitcoin, that should be the first priority here, when you have learnt, you can then give back to the community by helping to answer the questions of others.- Jay -

comments.author: Rexlus
comments.body: Every organization have their code and charter, not just here in the forum only. Thou am a newbie but Base on my finding about these forum, These forums sees spam as spontaneous literature for commoditie, facilities. Mostly avoid plagiarism, make advantageous POS in other to learn. Having a clean sheets (keep good record) to avoid negative trust.

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: Quote from: halim50_ on April 13, 2023, 06:02:49 AMSo dear seniors and good peoples, can you please give me some simple but effective Direction to improve me?the simplest way(even though actually doing it is not really simple) I can think of is to read, learn, and discuss, that is basically what you need to improve. read, learn or join discussions about what really interests you to expand your knowledge and join or create discussions on what you've learned.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: halim50_ on April 13, 2023, 06:02:49 AMI am determined to do a contribution in here but no matter how hard I try I failing to execute my determination.How come it will fail if you are fully determin what you want to contribute. If you are talking about merited post, then you should make more improvement by dealing with your content. Its okay if theres no merit popping in, it doesnt mean you arent a good poster, you just continue it and dont mind if its appreciated or not but as long as you did help or contirbute something thats fine.Also dont be too hard on yourself or pressuring to do more than what you need to share. Topics here can be discuss naturally and no need to make every threads just to meant you are contributing. A simple replied might be helpful already if you suggested or recomended something in a topic. Anyway you are doing great. Ive seen some seriously wanted to change their routine and thats already a big step.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: It's something that don't need to be discussed, just like asking how to become a good guy? of course you can give money to everyone and they will become more respect to you.You don't have to become useful and productive in this forum, no one force you to always being active. You must be have an activity outside in this forum and you're either working or still want to get a degree, you just need to being normal and only discuss what you can or what you're interested.

comments.author: Ahli38
comments.body: what I can suggest is Try to fill yourself more with broader insights that will be useful for everyone in this forum or in the real world.we will be useful people for others if we have an advantage that we can share with others. whether it's in the form of insight or expertise and the like.and so it is for this forum. Increase insight, read more, be more active in discussions and don't be shy to ask if something is difficult to understand and don't hesitate to share any insights you have that can be useful for those who read them in this forum. because the most effective way to remember the insights we have so that we don't easily forget them is to share them more often with others.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: You can start by deleting you bounty report post, they make you post history look shitty.Afterwards, get yourself some begginers friendly material that will teach you more about bitcoin and crypto entirely, because if youre looking to contribute then atleast you need to possess some knowledge about that thing (you don't have to know everything about bitcoin before you can start contributing in discussions here).lastly, be consistent. Iam not saying that you should devote your whole day to bitcointalk but you should try as musch as possiblr to just log in even if ou don't get to make an post you can just navigate around the fotum and try to learn something new so that wh next that topic is being discuss you will have something to contribute...

comments.author: dzungmobile
comments.body: Quote from: halim50_ on April 13, 2023, 06:02:49 AMI just wondering, how to be more useful and productive on this forum.You should try to become more useful but should not try to be more productive as it can mislead you to lower your quality.The forum is mainly for Bitcoin and Bitcoin discussions so a best way to be useful here is to be able to contribute for the community about Bitcoin technical support, discussion and similarities. You can start by learning first and improve your knowledge, then begin with helping people in your ability from simple questions to more difficult questions with time.There are other things which you can help others to enhance their security, privacy and more.Learn me a BitcoinBitcoin information and resourcesMastering BitcoinCryptocurrency security checklistReminder: do not keep your money in online accounts[General] Bitcoin Wallets - Which, what, why?[GUIDE] How to Safely Download and Verify Electrum

comments.author: Godlovesyou
comments.body: I have similar problem here, trying to be useful in the forum but I think we need to pay more attention to areas we're best good at, most at times we try to do what we're not, trying to said what you can't defend. Personally I have decided to do more of listening, readings, and questioning posts and comments of others, so that I can stand my ground and figure out the areas am best at.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Ask yourself — how would a person be more useful in a forum/group that's all about Call of Duty, Roblox, or whatever video game? You simply contribute by conversing(in a non-spam manner) about whatever aspect of that certain game. Same thing with Bitcointalk.You don't even need to spam "guide" threads.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: Quote from: halim50_ on April 13, 2023, 06:02:49 AMI just wondering, how to be more useful and productive on this forum.Well, to begin with, I suggest you stop cheating and abusing contests and bounty campaigns with your alt accounts. It's not only unethical but it also goes against the spirit of fair play and community building that this forum stands for.Instead, focus on engaging in meaningful discussions and sharing helpful information.

comments.author: asawale
comments.body: Quote from: halim50_ on April 13, 2023, 06:02:49 AMI just wondering, how to be more useful and productive on this forum.I am determined to do a contribution in here but no matter how hard I try I failing to execute my determination.So dear seniors and good peoples, can you please give me some simple but effective Direction to improve me?                                                                                     It will be honor to have some Direction..Everyone is useful in their own ways based on the contributions made. You bring want you understand about a crypto base issues, economy as as well as politics for people to learn while you learn from others members too. Most especially the high rank members of the forum.Just ensure you research well on whatever you want to make as a post here to avoid misleading others. And do not hesitate to expose any new scam methods you see somewhere in order to caution other, most especially the newbies from falling victims.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: Godlovesyou on April 13, 2023, 09:10:07 AMI have similar problem here, trying to be useful in the forum but I think we need to pay more attention to areas we're best good at, most at times we try to do what we're not, trying to said what you can't defend. Personally I have decided to do more of listening, readings, and questioning posts and comments of others, so that I can stand my ground and figure out the areas am best at.You have a very distorted understanding of the usefulness of the forum. Creating a thousand threads that don't talk about anything useful will be defined as a detriment to the forum rather than a benefit. But no matter what you say, your supposedly smart conclusions still do not say that you see the situation correctly.This is exactly the same for the OP. OP, it will do you good not to litter the forum with topics that have been discussed many times; other than that, don't consider yourself too tricky, thinking that no one sees anything.I would just like to advise all followers similar to these two that all first topics are always considered on a larger scale by users, including the entire posting history of the creators of new topics. It is desirable to see the sequence of all topics so that one day your fantasies do not put you in an awkward position.

comments.author: Fullcoinese
comments.body: I guess it would be simple to do it. what makes you always fail in your? if you want to be in the forum, then try to give more of your time to the forum. if you can't then try to be consistent every day and come and read what will give you another knowledge. Try to be active in discussions on topics you know about. if still learning, then read more. I too have been in a phase like you.

comments.author: Yaunfitda
comments.body: Quote from: halim50_ on April 13, 2023, 06:02:49 AMI just wondering, how to be more useful and productive on this forum.I am determined to do a contribution in here but no matter how hard I try I failing to execute my determination.So dear seniors and good peoples, can you please give me some simple but effective Direction to improve me?                                                                                     It will be honor to have some Direction..I guess you just be yourself though, there is no secret formula on how you can more useful or production in this community. Just engage and have conversation with others, share your thoughts or pick a subject that you are familiar with and then comment, participate in the discussions.If your goal is to rank up, then be constructive and don't just write non-sense. Treat it just like in a community in real life, show respect and give contributions. Best of luck in your journey here.

comments.author: Litzki1990
comments.body: Since you yourself said that you are not able to contribute anything good to the forum even after trying so hard then you must know why you are not able to contribute well to the forum. Try to improve on what you are not good at. Don't pay too much attention to who praised your post or who badmouthed your post. Like yourself, keep posting like yourself.But don't stress too much try to do as much as you can. It is not your responsibility to immediately do something for the forum. Take time and improve yourself little by little so you can reach your goals. If you compare yourself with the senior members who are there then it won't be because they have joined this forum from long time and they have no knowledge about the forum. So try to learn from them instead of comparing with them.

The best thing to do to improve our self is dealing with people through discussion using our advantages or using our knowledge. For example if Op have an expertise about one specific topic the he can join and share ideas for relevance topic. So for Op all I can say is that be your selves and find a good topic that suites to your knowledge then you can share and learn as as well.

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: The best practice is to learn and exchange knowledge on the forum which will help you to contribute effectively in the forum.There are many helpful threads which you can go through to enhance your knowledge no matter how much time it will take.You just need to be determined not to gain merits and rank up fast as others but focus more on acquiring knowledge that will help you to write useful posts.Take part in discussion which you know and just read to see what experience members say about that topic.This is not like competitive exams but you are free to post but try to learn from it which is best practice for what you are looking for.
